_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Iron and Steel Pipe and Tube Manufacturing from Purchased Steel

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
In this executive summary, only one process has been included.
The process is identified as Process 1 and refers to the storage 
of the toxic substance Anhydrous Ammonia at the Dormont facility.
The process does not have any Accident History, hence the process 
is a very safe process, and is not likely to harm any receptors in
and around the facility.
The public in general is informed of the process through Dormont's 
association and work with the Westmoreland County Department of Public 
Safety as well as it's extensive involvement with other local 
authorities.  The public is also aware that a Prevention Program 
exists at the facility.  Process 1 falls under Program Level 3 and hence 
a Prevention Program for Program Level 3 was developed and implemented 
for the NAICS Code 33121.
The facility follows an Emergency Response Plan that takes due care of 
any accidents that may occur at the facility.  
Also, the facility's ER Plan includes specific steps that are taken to
prevent an accidental release as well as chemical specific prevention 
steps to be taken in response to accidental releases of the regulated 
substance, Anhydrous Ammonia.
Further the plan includes information on emergency healthcare.
Also, the review of the ER Plan was done on 6/15/99.  
The facility's ER Plan details exactly how the facility coordinates with 
the Westmoreland County Department of Public Safety on program review, 
training and inspections.
At Dormont, the Emergency Planning Committee members are annually 
reviewing existing processes for any deficiencies within the system for
the purposes of ensuring our employees the safest workplace possible.
The worst-case scenario and the alternative release scenarios were 
calculated utilizing the EPA OCA Analysis Guidelines.  Along with the 
guidelines, Dormont has developed administrative controls such as;  
loading of Ammonia on off-shifts and fair weather conditions, as well as 
numerous mitigation measures including, but not limited to a

water sprinkler 
system and automatic shutdown valves.
Dormont is truly committed to providing a facility that is safe and 
environmentally sound for both working and living in the surrounding community.
